page.title: 16THE PEOPLE
page.content:
An increasing number of people have reached retirement age. A block of houses has been built especially for the elderly.
A number of men work in the forest. With the increasing use of machinery on a farm very few farmers employ agricultural workers. The men have then to look to Huntly or Keith or even further afield for employment. This leads them to look for a home nearer their work.
Their homes are then taken over by the unemployed who then move back to the town when they find employment. So a fraction of the population always seems to be on the move.
